lead_paragraph: Through its periodic lists of the best young novelists, the British literary magazine Granta has built a reputation for spotting and promoting emerging talents long before they become widely known. A 1983 list of British writers included Martin Amis, Julian Barnes, William Boyd, Ian McEwan, Salman Rushdie, and Graham Swift, while a similar inventory of American writers in 1996 drew attention to Sherman Alexie, Madison Smartt Bell, Edwidge Danticat, Jonathan Franzen and Lorrie Moore.
snippet: The literary publication has ventured for the first time outside the Anglophone realm, to the Western world's second most widely spoken language.

headline.main: Granta Names Best Young Novelists Writing in Spanish

abstract: The literary publication has ventured for the first time outside the Anglophone realm, to the Western world's second most widely spoken language.
